issues.description: Problem statement for Aufgabe 06 requests the number (an aggregate/count) of Wanderwege that lead to Gemeinden with mehr als 500000 männlichen Einwohnern, but the solution file returns rows (SELECT *) instead of an aggregate COUNT. This contradicts the specified output shape and would mislead students about the intended result (they expect a single numeric count).
issues.suggested_fix: Change the solution query to return a count/aggregate consistent with the task. For example: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Gemeinde, Wanderweg_zu_Gemeinde WHERE Gemeinde.schluessel = Wanderweg_zu_Gemeinde.gemeindeschluessel AND Gemeinde.einwohner_m > 500000; (or COUNT(DISTINCT Wanderweg_zu_Gemeinde.radweg_id) if the intent is to count distinct wanderwege).

issues.description: Problem statement for Aufgabe 09 asks for the names of all Zoos in a Gemeinde named "Nürnberg", but the solution filters for Gemeinde.name = 'Erlangen'. The filter value in the solution contradicts the task requirement and will produce the wrong result set.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the WHERE clause in the solution to filter for the requested municipality name. For example: WHERE Zoo.gemeindeschluessel = Gemeinde.schluessel AND Gemeinde.name = 'Nürnberg';
